Hands down one of the top 3 worst games I've ever had the misfortune of buying, playing, and even help debug.  The developer Actalogic is just not up to par to develop quality games, since they use an outdated and broken game engine that has so many holes you'd think it was Fallout New Vegas' Hoover Dam being fought over by the NCR and Ceasar's Legion.

For 1 whole month a number of players and the CEO of Actalogic tried to work together to debug the game by testing over and over to make a list of reproducable errors (not all that easy to do for some).  Each little 'patch' would end up plugging one hole to only create 3 new holes in the 'Hoover Dam' that is AG2013.  In the end Mr. CeO just left for vacation and never returned leaving us with a long list of promises and upcoming updates.

IF you're lucky to get it to work on your PC and think all is smooth sailing, just wait...you just wait.   Play the game using the same save file for 20+hrs using the equipment to build your own farm up.  Then, you'll know what we already know.

reviewText:
This game is as good ideawise just as bad it is from the technical point of view. In other words, it definitely has wonderful realistic features that other farming simulators do not offer, but it is a horrible buggy software that basically does not run.

Pro:
- It has tasks like attaching detaching implements to the tractor and filling up seeds in the sower manually which is realistic. Like you have to manually drage sacks of grain in first person instead of just pressing keys from inside the tractor.
- Animal husbandry is elaborate and complicated. Again manual feeding tasks and also gathering of milk and eggs in a realistic way.
- Good landscapes
- Lots of different crop options

Cons:
- Glitchy, slow, low fps
- Will crash several times
- Impossible to continue having patience with it
- Bad graphics optimization

So in spite of having great interest in it, I had to basically abandon trying to play this. Point to note is that its predecessor Agrar Sim 2011 is a much stable product softwarewise, Although its gameplay and feature set is very different.

If you're looking for a good simulator for farming/agriculture, this game is not your game. Perhaps, it may be much better if I WAS ABLE TO PLAY THE GAME RIGHT. Sadly, because of my previous woe with the performance, I was not able to try much of the game out, so for those with really powerful computers and want to try this, go ahead, but don't expect much.

reviewText:
So, I bought this game once it was available (in beta) on steam. The game was not that bad, but it had some major issues with gameplay. So I was waiting and during that I was able to play it.. more or less.... and after some patch or what.... it was even more broken than before. I couldnt play it anymore. I decided to wait for some patches ? Fixes ? Now after a very loooong time I upgraded my PC. This is compare for games recommended HW configuration and my HW configuration:

Recommended HW        My HW                Windows 7        Windows 7 64bit                2.6 GHz Quad Core (Intel Core i5, AMD Phenom X4)        4.00GHz Intel Core i7 4790k                4GB RAM        16GB RAM            Geforce GTX 560 or Radeon HD 7790        GTX 980 4GB            Dx 9.0        Dx 11.1
And the result ? So I'm forced to lower my Graphic setting to medium (to make game run at + - 60FPS 1080p) and my game runs at 1080p with very unstable FPS (18FPS is the lowest I had). I drive around map and my FPS jumping like some bunny.... 18, 40, 30, 50, 60, 40, 30.... LOLz. Very badly optimized game and what is even more sad..... the game developers obviously decided to leave this game as it is and dont bother to come up with some patch to fix this.... nice.

Other than that... I think this game have some good potential.... it could be one of the best farming sim games there ever was.... agrar sim 2011 is just one empty boring game.... this game could have been so much better.... there are so many things you can do.... seed, harvest, have animals like sheeps, cows, bulls, horses, feed them, sell them, sell their products, manage your greenhouses, water crops there and much more. I think that those greenhouses in this game are so much more fun to play with than in any other farming sim game.... I was really enjoying it until that patch they once released completely made my game to not run slightly playable anymore.

So my rating for this game is like 4/10 - I DO NOT recommend. If you cant play it properly, you cant enjoy it and if you cant enjoy it, there is no reason to buy this game. Right now with my PC I'm slightly able to play it again and it makes it even more sad that developers decided to dont give a ♥♥♥♥ about this game. At the start they seem that they really care about this game... they were actively responding to players in discussion section, were giving some tips on how to make the game run.

If you are some game developer and want to release game in beta with bugs and other problems... trust me... it can NEVER end well. Your game will be always the game that was buggy and horrible even when you release patches and fixes to repair it... or if you not... then it will end up like this game. Total disaster. So sad...

reviewText:
I want to like this game. I want to like it so much, but I can't. For every right thing this game does there are three things done wrong.

Most glaringly, the game performs terribly on its higher settings. I have a GTX 770 with a 570 for PhysX, 16 GB RAM, and an i5 overclocked to 4 Ghz. It can't handle AgrarSim 2013 on anything higher than Medium. Know this before playing it.

Now on to the gameplay. Common to all the other farming simulations out there, the game's tutorial only cares about teaching you how to operate the machinery. The tutorial doesn't tell you anything about:

1. Making fields (you can just plow anywhere, it turns out, and marking them out on the map is only for the benefit of AI workers).
2. How and where to sell your harvest (the mill, the town, the agrarian centre).
3. How and where to buy the things you need, like animals, seeds, and fertilisers (seed bags from town, seed loads from the agrarian centre, animals from the stables).
4. How to buy new equipment (the O key).
5. The differences between scenarios (the two hardest scenarios for each map have the same descriptions, but the second one is easier because it gives you an extra $10,000 and some basic machinery).
6. Where things are on the map and how to use the map view.
7. How to advance to the next day (hold down Ctrl and click on the sun icon near the clock).

The game requires a LOT of micro-management. You need to drive your harvest to the sale point. You need to buy individual bags of seed to load the bottom-of-the-line ('historical') seeder, and you need to load those bags into the seeder yourself. There is a grain shower that you can use to load trailers with grain from your silo, but you can't use it to load the historical seeder. You need a gravity hopper to bag your grain so that you can load the seeder. You need to drive your machinery all the way to the agrarian centre to sell it, and in the early game your tractor does an average of 15 mph, so it takes about 10 minutes to travel anywhere.

AgrarSim 2013 is also legendary for its crazy physics and unintuitive behaviour. Attachments fall at awkward angles that prevent attachment, and there's no way to rescue or reset them. A several-ton combine harvester can do a backflip when driven over a furrow at 5 mph. The historical seeder can often go nuts and flip your tractor over. There's no way to nudge around an unhitched trailer on foot, so you need to keep adjusting your tractor. If you try to sprint while carrying a seed bag, its collider bumps up against you and slows you down. The on-foot FOV is the narrowest I've ever seen in a video game (45° horizontal), and you will be disoriented for a second or two every time you step off the tractor. The mill won't buy trailers full of grain from you, it only wants bags. A MILL, FOR GOD'S SAKE. And one time I loaded some bags of grain onto a trailer and brought it halfway home, then saved the game and played something else. When I reloaded, the grain bags were gone! Just disappeared into the aether, never to be seen again!

And yet for all its massive, unforgiveable problems and its numerous hair-tearing moments of frustration and confusion, AgrarSim offers something you can't get out of any other game right now. Because you see, when you drop a plow into the ground in AgrarSim, it actually digs out a furrow. It's a hole, an excavation, you can stand inside it. And when you drag a cultivator over that land, it smooths the furrows out. The simple act of working the soil is immediate and rewarding, and when you seed it and see your crops springing up there's a great sense of satisfaction and wonder.

I think as a gaming experience, this game is worth about $5. As a simulator it's worth about $0.50. The gameplay is just too unpredictable. But it sure is fun to work the land!

reviewText: Agricultural Simulator 2013 - Steam Edition, is a simulator that allows you to learn all of the aspects of running a modern farm, from the comfort of your chair. As far as simulators go, it is one of the easiest I've seen in a long time. The tutorial walks you through each step and let's you play through the process of how to hook up and unhook equipment, manage fields and livestock, maintaining your equipment, as well as much more. You are given a choice of 4 different regions to choose from, as well as three different maps. The farm equipment used in-game, is based on actual equipment farmers use,  bringing another immersive level to the game.\n\nCampaign mode is available, aside from tutorial missions, and you can also start a new game and build your own fully functioning Agricultural Farm from the ground up with only the bare minimum. Campaign mode has several missions for you to complete, for those want a little more direction, and there are a bunch of different types of crops you can grow. They seem to have a pretty healthy selection, each with their own challenges and rewards. All in all this is a pretty fun simulator, which kind of surprised me. I didn't think farming would actually be fun, but if you like simulator games, this is a good one to try out.

reviewText:
The game concept is great.  I like the farming simulators and I like the concept of actually working to feed your animals and taking in the barns and all that stuff, but this one is not as realistic as the ones in the past and the bugs and crashes within the game are to numerous to mention.  If the creators of the game would actually take the time to make it right by removing all of the bugs and crashes and with all of the concepts still in the game, then this game would be worth a whole lot more to people who actually enjoy these games.

I can't recommend this product due to the bugs and crashes as mentioned, but if they come out with a game that doesn't crash all the time then I would more than honored to recommend a game when it works.  I know the creators of the game Actalogic can make a great game.  I have a few of their other games -- Farming Giant and Industry Empire to name a couple -- and they're great games, a bit buggy but not nearly as bad as this game or the 2011 and 2012 version.  In fact, I still play the 2011 game.

If I can get it, I plan to ask for my money back on this game.
